modules.simulator package¶

Subpackages¶

  • modules.simulator.hdc package
    • Submodules
    • modules.simulator.hdc.model module

Submodules¶

modules.simulator.noise module¶

This module provides noise modules mainly for training and evaluating policies.

class Noise(domain: utils.domain.jsonlookupdomain.JSONLookupDomain, train_error_rate: float, test_error_rate: float, pdf: List[float] = [0.7, 0.3, 0.0], logger: utils.logger.DiasysLogger = <DiasysLogger adviser (NOTSET)>)[source]¶

Bases: modules.module.Module

The base class for every noise module implementing a forward function.

This class takes care of permuting an intent, slot or value depending on a probability. The functions permute_* need to be implemented by the inheriting class.

Parameters

  • domain (Domain) – The domain for which the user simulator will be instantiated. It will probably only work within this domain.

  • train_error_rate (float) – The training error rate. 1 equals 100% train error.

  • test_error_rate (float) – The testing error rate. 1 equals 100% testing error.

  • pdf (List[float]) – The pdf for either permuting value, slot or intent (in this order).

deactivate()[source]¶

Disables any noise from this module.

forward(dialog_graph: dialogsystem.DialogSystem, user_acts: List[utils.useract.UserAct], **kwargs) → {'user_acts': typing.List[utils.useract.UserAct]}[source]¶

Permutes the given user actions, therefore 1) it is determined whether a user action will be permuted at all (depending on training/testing) and 2) chooses the value, slot or intent from a pdf for permutation.

Parameters

  • dialog_graph (DialogSystem) – The calling instance of the dialog system; used to determine the current turn.

  • user_acts (List[UserAct]) – The system action for which a user response will be retrieved.

  • kwargs (dict) – Any other arguments in the pipeline.

Returns

Dictionary including the noisy/permuted user actions as

a list.

Return type

Dict[user_acts=List[UserAct]]

abstract permute_intent(action)[source]¶

Abstract method, needs to be overridden by subclass.

abstract permute_slot(action)[source]¶

Abstract method, needs to be overridden by subclass.

abstract permute_value(action)[source]¶

Abstract method, needs to be overridden by subclass.

reset()[source]¶

Resets the noise probability to whatever it was before deactivation or (if it wasn’t deactivated) to the value on initialisation.

update(train_error_rate: float = None, test_error_rate: float = None)[source]¶

Changes the current training or testing error rate.

Parameters

  • train_error_rate (float) – The error rate while training..

  • test_error_rate (float) – The error rate while testing.

class SimpleNoise(domain: utils.domain.jsonlookupdomain.JSONLookupDomain, train_error_rate: float, test_error_rate: float, pdf: List[float] = [0.7, 0.3, 0.0], logger: utils.logger.DiasysLogger = <DiasysLogger adviser (NOTSET)>)[source]¶

Bases: modules.simulator.noise.Noise

Simple noise which permutes intent, slot and value by drawing uniformly from the possibilities.

Parameters

  • domain (Domain) – The domain for which the user simulator will be instantiated. It will probably only work within this domain.

  • train_error_rate (float) – The training error rate. 1 equals 100% train error.

  • test_error_rate (float) – The testing error rate. 1 equals 100% testing error.

  • pdf (List[float]) – The pdf for either permuting value, slot or intent (in this order).

permute_intent(action)[source]¶

CURRENTLY DEACTIVATED

Permutes the intent of an action by chossing from all other intents uniformly. If the new intent needs a slot or value, appropriate values are drawn uniformly.

Parameters

action (UserAct) – The action for which the intent will be permuted.

permute_slot(action)[source]¶

Permutes the intent of an action by chossing from all other intents uniformly. If the new intent needs a slot or value, appropriate values are drawn uniformly.

Parameters

action (UserAct) – The action for which the slot will be permuted.

permute_value(action)[source]¶

Permutes the intent of an action by chossing from all other intents uniformly. If the new intent needs a slot or value, appropriate values are drawn uniformly.

Parameters

action (UserAct) – The action for which the value will be permuted.

modules.simulator.simulator module¶

This module provides user simulators mainly for training and evaluating policies.

class UserSimulator(domain: utils.domain.domain.Domain, logger: utils.logger.DiasysLogger = <DiasysLogger adviser (NOTSET)>)[source]¶

Bases: modules.module.Module

The base class for a user simulator.

This class provides a reset and a forward function for user simulators. Any user simulator should inherit from this class.

Parameters

  • domain (Domain) – The domain for which the user simulator will be instantiated. It will

  • only work within this domain. (probably) –

forward(dialog_graph: dialogsystem.DialogSystem, sys_act: utils.sysact.SysAct = None, **kwargs) → {'user_acts': typing.List[utils.useract.UserAct], 'sim_goal': <class 'utils.goal.Goal'>}[source]¶

Will use the inheriting user simulator to retrieve a user response based on the given system action.

Parameters

  • dialog_graph (DialogSystem) – The calling instance of the dialog system; used to determine the current turn.

  • sys_act (SysAct) – The system action for which a user response will be retrieved.

  • kwargs (dict) – Any other arguments in the pipeline.

Returns

Dictionary including the user acts as a list and the current user’s goal.

Return type

dict

receive(sys_act)[source]¶

Processes the received system action. Needs to be implemented by the inheriting class.

respond()[source]¶

Returns the next user action. Needs to be implemented by the inheriting class.

Module contents¶

This package contains all modules concerning user simulators.
